DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total amount of drug agent to be administered per the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the drug agent used for the protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Use caBIG NCIt based OC instead. - dw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
